intro: Hieracium monopsidiceps, commonly known as the single-seed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium monopsidiceps is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting pollinators.
